definition: scene (in a movie etc)/one's part in a movie or play/(archaic) actor's payment
classifier for gifts, newspaper, magazine, papers, reports, contracts etc/variant of 分[fen4]

sentences.english: Harry doesn't do a lot of especially interesting things in Deathly Hallows.
sentences.chinese: 哈利在《死亡聖器》裏並沒有太多出彩的戲份。

sentences.english: The steamy honeymoon scenes were filmed late last year when Bella and Edward consummate their marriage
sentences.chinese: 而蜜月新婚夜的戲份早已在去年年底拍攝完成。

sentences.english: In this never-ending drama we call life, everyone has a part to play.
sentences.chinese: 在人生這場永不落幕的戲劇中，人人都有自己的戲份。

sentences.english: She's probably also responsible for toughening up the Bond girls.
sentences.chinese: 她大概對邦德女郎戲份日趨加重也有影響。

sentences.english: Plus we have the fact that the weather might play some cards.
sentences.chinese: 另外，天氣可能還會搶點戲份。

sentences.english: GL : Yes, he has a prominent part in the next film.
sentences.chinese: 會的，在下一部電影裏他有很重要的戲份。

sentences.english: Therefore, in recent scriptwriter can only minimize the focus on this actor's Xifen.
sentences.chinese: 所以編劇只能在近幾集中儘量減少這名演員的戲份。

sentences.english: Ginny is seen in Half-Blood Prince more than in any other book.
sentences.chinese: 金妮在《混血王子》中的戲份超過其他任何一部。

sentences.english: As rumored, the film includes a brief sequence with dinosaurs.
sentences.chinese: 謠傳電影中將有恐龍的短暫戲份。

sentences.english: How many episodes can we expect to see you in for Season 5?
sentences.chinese: 你在第五季裏有多少集的戲份？

definition: script for play, opera, movie etc/screenplay/scenario
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe
to put on a play/to perform/fig. to pretend/to feign
cast and crew/performers and production team
to begin shooting (a movie, a scene of a movie etc)/to start the bidding (auction)/to start a trading session (stock market)
slot within a schedule/timeslot (for a TV program, a session with a photographer etc)/range of dates in which an event is to be held (film screening, exhibition etc)
dialogue (in a movie or a play)
